snippet: A new report from AARP finds that foreclosure rates for people over 75 grew eightfold from 2007 to 2011, and that the risk of “serious delinquency” on mortgages has grown fastest for people over 50.
abstract: Report from AARP finds that older Americans, once viewed as the most fiscally stable age group, are facing increasingly desperate financial troubles; report finds that foreclosure rates for people over 75 grew eightfold from 2007 to 2011, and that the risk of serious delinquency on mortgages has grown fastest for people over 50.
lead_paragraph: A new report from AARP finds that foreclosure rates for people over 75 grew eightfold from 2007 to 2011, and that the risk of “serious delinquency” on mortgages has grown fastest for people over 50.

headline.seo: Foreclosure Rates Surge For Older Americans, AARP Says
